fields.description:
Hello,

As i can see for now there is not any ability to directly edit the source code of an Snippet unless you have to open the Snippet view page and then selecting Edit in order to edit, now the head request is to add an icon at the right of the listing all snippets page in order to when someone clicks on it (with access) to redirect automatically in edit source code.

Image Example: http://i.imgur.com/bwPaE4n.png

(I hope my suggestion will not go in recycle bin as the others did)

* Thanks!
fields.summary: Add "Edit" icon at the right to enter directly in source code edit

fields.description:
Started on overview page.\\
When I clicked this link: http://prntscr.com/g46o5i (screenshot)\\
I got redirected to an empty page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Get+started+with+Bitbucket+Cloud
fields.summary: Started on overview page...

fields.description:
This seems like faulty behavior when creating pull request tasks:

# Create PR, and create tasks for said PR
# Complete the task
# Try and merge the PR

You'll see that the merge will not complete and it will still complain there are unresolved tasks, even though it shows as all tasks are resolved. The workaround is simply unchecking the task and re-checking it.
fields.summary: Checked tasks on pull requests sometimes prevent merges

fields.description: It is very disheartening to spend over an hour modifying a page on the Wiki to only find out that it doesn't support any HTML, and then even more so to find out you can't revert back to another version from the History page.
fields.summary: Wiki History should have feature to revert to a previous Wiki Page version

fields.description:
Once reducing the size of the window the left bar loses its alignment

h3. How to reproduce
* With the new UI enabled, open any repo's overview page.
* Click on the button to hide the left bar.
* Reduces the window size.
* The left bar should lose the alignment of the icons.\\
Regular size.\\
!776688108-Screen%20Shot%202017-08-03%20at%2012.47.04%20PM.png|thumbnail!\\
Reduced size.\\
!3422570469-Screen%20Shot%202017-08-03%20at%2012.47.50%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New UI - Once reducing the size of the window the left bar loses its alignment - Customer

fields.description: not able to enable 2 step verification for the user rishi1.singh tagged with email ID [removed]
fields.summary: Some users are not able to enable 2 step verification (BBCDEV-7651)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing a Pull request, the 'Reviewers' field is overlapping the 'Recent' field in Safari browser.

h3. Environment
Safari 10.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to edit a PR in a Bitbucket Cloud repo in Safari

h3. Expected Results
The 'Recent' field should be visible: !3630532408-Screen%20Shot%202017-08-03%20at%2010.50.54.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The 'Recent' field is not visible: !3974529249-Screen%20Shot%202017-08-03%20at%2010.51.01.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: in Safari, the 'Reviewers' field in PRs is hiding the 'Recent' field below it

fields.description:
SVN imports have been disabled in Bitbucket Cloud due to some technical issues.

There are some users who would like to have this re-enabled so they can import SVN repos.
fields.summary: As a user I'd like to be able to import SVN repos in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
When merging branches together in the WEB UI, It would be very useful to see a copy of the commit messages from all the previous commits being merged into target branch appended to the merge commit message message so our developers can see what messages are pulled with the merge, in turn these messages go to our deployment system where seeing just "Merged branch A into B" is pretty useless line to see in the logs.

Basically in the same manner a Pull Request concatenates commit messages but to do it for the Merge and Sync Quick links too.

The ability to create a commit message templates and have certain branches use certain templates on specified action triggers would be fantastic.

Merged branch *A* into *B*

_<append new commit messages from commits not in B>_
fields.summary: Persistent Commit Messages on Merge

fields.description:
On the Pipeline page, the keyboard shortcuts do not work consistently. It seems that if the browser focus is on the nav bars on the left (in the new nav views), they do work, but if the focus is on the pipelines portion of the page itself, they do not work. When the page loads, it is in the non-working state - mouse click on the nav bars on the left to put focus there.

Also, there is no keyboard shortcut to navigate to the Pipelines within a Repository.  (R - P is taken for Pull Requests (that should have been R-R, perhaps), therefore I suggest L for Line or something like that).
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts do not work from Pipeline page

fields.description:
When you push a branch based on {{master}} that was already tested through pipelines this branch should be skipped.

In my workflow I always push the new branch, and the pipeline runs again even though this commit was already tested (since it's based on {{master}} and points to the same commit).

This could save build time.
fields.summary: Skip run Pipelines on merged branches

fields.description:
If you have a Mercurial repo with a PR and then push a successor commit which makes the commit in the PR obsolete you should not be able to merge the PR.

I just had an interesting race condition where before I updated the PR, it was merged.
fields.summary: [hg] Prevent merging a PR with obsolete changesets

fields.description:
We need to know, for audit purposes who all has\\
access to which of our repositories, and at what permission level.\\
Currently, this involves separate API calls for getting a list of groups\\
that have access to a repo. And a call to pull the same for non-grouped\\
users.

Ideally, I'd like to see a call that implements the access query that\\
enumerates both groups and individuals, then includes the group expansion\\
once, maybe in a separate section of the response (a separate call would be\\
OK for that, assuming I could submit multiple groups).
fields.summary: Add users privileges request to API 2.0 to simplify access audit for Admins

fields.description:
We had a user, who has an open pull request. After this users access removed from the repository, jenkins pull request task stopped working, merge and decline buttons were also not working.

I have been pulling my hair for over 4 hours to find the source of why jenkins pr checks stopped working. Finally able to found this was the issue.

After merging that PR manually into the master via SourceTree all PR check jobs in Jenkins started to work simultaneously.
fields.summary: If a users access revoked with open pull request in repository; merge, decline and bitbucket PR plug-in is not working

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I am getting below error. I have installed GIT for first time and started using it today

480069@LT062845 MINGW64 /d/Git\\
$ git clone https://santosh191177@bitbucket.org/santosh191177/omsai_repo1.git\\
Cloning into 'omsai_repo1'...\\
fatal: unable to access 'https://santosh191177@bitbucket.org/santosh191177/omsai_repo1.git/': Failed to connect to bitbucket.org port 443: Connection refused

I tried to update host file with below entry but now help

Regards\\
Santosh
fields.summary: Unable to clone a repo in GIT

fields.description:
All our pipelines are currently failing. All of the errors occur during the setup phase. For example:

{code}
#!python

+ hg clone --noupdate REDACTED
applying clone bundle from https://media-api.atlassian.io/REDACTED
** Unknown exception encountered with possibly-broken third-party extension useragent
** which supports versions unknown of Mercurial.
** Please disable useragent and try your action again.
** If that fixes the bug please report it to the extension author.
** Python 2.7.12 (default, Jun 29 2016, 09:11:45) [GCC 5.3.0]
** Mercurial Distributed SCM (version 3.7.3)
** Extensions loaded: useragent
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/hg", line 43, in <module>
    mercurial.dispatch.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 54, in run
    sys.exit((dispatch(request(sys.argv[1:])) or 0) & 255)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 120, in dispatch
    ret = _runcatch(req)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 191, in _runcatch
    return _dispatch(req)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 924, in _dispatch
    cmdpats, cmdoptions)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 681, in runcommand
    ret = _runcommand(ui, options, cmd, d)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 1055, in _runcommand
    return checkargs()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 1015, in checkargs
    return cmdfunc()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/dispatch.py", line 921, in <lambda>
    d = lambda: util.checksignature(func)(ui, *args, **cmdoptions)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/util.py", line 991, in check
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/commands.py", line 1563, in clone
    shareopts=opts.get('shareopts'))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/hg.py", line 595, in clone
    streamclonerequested=stream)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/exchange.py", line 1185, in pull
    _maybeapplyclonebundle(pullop)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/exchange.py", line 1780, in _maybeapplyclonebundle
    if trypullbundlefromurl(repo.ui, repo, url):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mercurial/exchange.py", line 1930, in trypullbundlefromurl
    ui.warn(_('error fetching bundle: %s\n') % e.reason[1])
IndexError: tuple index out of range

{code}

And another build showed:

{code}
#!python



+ hg clone --noupdate REDACTED
applying clone bundle from https://media-api.atlassian.io/REDACTED
HTTP error fetching bundle: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error
abort: error applying bundle
(if this error persists, consider contacting the server operator or disable clone bundles via "--config ui.clonebundles=false")
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines builds are failing due to setup errors

fields.description:
Currently in Bitbucket Cloud, navigating within a page with the keyboard (page up / page down) does not work until there is a first mouse click.

*Steps to reproduce*

# Click "Pull Request"
# Use keyboard to navigate up/down the page and there is no response
# Click on the page and try navigating with keyboard and it works fine.

It would be useful to be able to navigate in a page using keyboard instead of requiring a mouse click first.
fields.summary: Cannot navigate in any page with keyboard without mouse click

fields.description:
The  popup for issues or similar popups , the contents are blurry with screen resolution is 1600x900, Browser Chrome 59.0.3071.115, Windows 7\\
on MAC with the same version of Chrome the view if fine and not blurry however, so seems Operating system specific

Workaround is to remove the transform: translateX and translateY on .aui-popup.bb-dialog
fields.summary: Blurry popup content with transform: TranslateX and TranslateY

fields.description: I'm moving from another build mechanism to Bitbucket pipelines. I need my builds to have a build nr > 600. I currently do not see any method to set the BITBUCKET_BUILD_NUMBER to start at this number and think that such a feature would be a good addition.
fields.summary: Be able to set an initial value for the BITBUCKET_BUILD_NUMBER variable

fields.description:
For Slack integration I needed to add the webhook for each and every repo. It would be awesome if I could set one webhook to trigger when a commit is added to any repo in a team.

I've been told on #bitbucket that you can use the API directly to add such a web hook but there is no UI for it.
fields.summary: Add Webhooks per Team

fields.description:
Branches endpoint of API v1 sometimes time outs for repos with a very large number of branches and returns a 500 or 502 error.

It would be more useful to the user to get a JSON response with an explanation for the error, e.g.:\\
"Timeout, the request has taken longer than X seconds before sending any\\
data back, this could be because you have too many branches"
fields.summary: When there is a timeout error with v1 API, return a more useful response to the user

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket Pipelines has 2 Hours execution time limit. Some builds requires more than 2 Hours to perform a build which included testing and deployment. The 2 hours limitations isn't sufficient for certain builds.

It would be a useful feature to be able to extend the Execution Build Limit for pipelines build.
fields.summary: Ability to extend Bitbucket Pipelines Execution Time

fields.description: If you want marketshare you need to have lower reasponse times. Times >1s are not going to cut it.
fields.summary: Bitbucket much slower than github

fields.description: Sites like Github have a policy to include files/directories of the master branch on public repos for webcrawlers. We would need to change our robots.txt policy to include this on our site too.
fields.summary: Improve robots.txt on public repos for web crawlers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Static website hosting does not work in Bitbucket Cloud if the account's name ends in 'api'

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team named e.g. teamfortestapi
# Create a repository in the team with the name teamfortestapi.bitbucket.io
# Create an index.html file in the repo
# Try to access https://teamfortestapi.bitbucket.io/

h3. Expected Results
The website loads

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown when loading the website: !2669160181-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-31%20at%2015.08.09.png|thumbnail!

Not Found

The requested URL / was not found on this server.
fields.summary: Static website hosting does not work in Bitbucket Cloud if the account's name ends in 'api'

fields.description:
In the repository details screen, the remaining storage amount is incorrectly displayed when user has ran out of available storage.

For example:\\
8192.0PB remaining
fields.summary: Incorrect Git Large File Storage remaining space displayed when user/team has ran out of storage

fields.description:
When I add my host (in SSH keys pipelines setting) and try to fetch fingerprint I get the following error message:

"Unable to fetch fingerprints, check host SSH connection and try again"

This started to happen last Friday, and since then is not working anymore. No changes were made on the host and I can SSH normally. Other repositories have been set with the same host before Friday are working.

Looks like is not able to find the host by some network reason? Could you please check it?\\
Host is 'qa-smartplugin.youbora.com'

Thanks.
fields.summary: Unable to fetch fingerprints

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Selecting 'Create branch' after searching for a branch, will show two overlapping dialogs to create a branch

h3. Environment
Chrome, latest version  60.0.3112.78

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a repository
# Go to {{Branches}}
# Enter any term in the search box at the top right of the page
# Then select 'Create branch'

h3. Expected Results
The 'Create branch' dialog will show normally: !2951477753-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-31%20at%2013.18.20.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Two dialogs show up like follows: !467859234-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-31%20at%2013.10.02.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Selecting 'Create branch' after searching for a branch, will show two overlapping dialogs to create a branch

fields.description:
If a repo is accidentally deleted, is there any way that it can be recovered from Bitbucket?

Can we also view all the deleted repos from a particular user? Can this be searched and recovered?
fields.summary: Deleted Repositories - Recoverable?

fields.description:
Hi,

Any way of bringing in a feature to force users to create repositories in the "Team account"? As premium users, we need a way of being able to track for and account what users are doing with the code. If they're creating repos in their own account, we no longer have this visibility.

Thanks.

Carl
fields.summary: Force users to use Team account?
Already added my uniq ssh-key to my repository. but still not work (read access only)

fields.description:
Normally when I push a commit, it can automatically resolve, close or reference Bitbucket Cloud Issue Tracker issues with in-message commands. Please add an "open" command so that I can use the commit message on the initial acceptance test to set an issue status to "open" instead of "new".\\
Thanks for the great work, guys!
fields.summary: Add an "open" commit-message command

fields.description: If would be great to be able to configure the Commits view in such a way that it still shows all branches, but specific branches are "locked" to the left of the visual graph, e.g. live, staging and master branch lines fixed to columns 1,2 & 3 respectively then additional feature/bug branches dance off to the right from there.
fields.summary: Lock selected branches in the "All Branches" commit list

fields.description:
If a user has disabled email in their Bitbucket Settings, there is no way for the user to accept a repository ownership transfer.

Users have to click on the link provided in the email to accept a repository transfer.

Bitbucket should provide a way on the UI to accept the transfer without relying on email.
fields.summary: Unable to accept repository ownership transfer if email notifications is disabled
Online editor does not terminate template literals

fields.description:
Here is my markdown

{code}
# jwt-service
Logic and express.js middleware for handling JWTs.
* Token issuing 
* Token reissuing (refresh)
* Token verification (signature, contents, expiry)
{code}

It was rendered this way:

!1030619748-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-28%20at%202.11.32%20pm.png|thumbnail!

Here is how Github renders it:

!3388555262-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-28%20at%202.13.10%20pm.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Makrdown is not renderred

fields.description:
It's simple enough:

We have some tests that we run with a compose file. The mysql image in that compose file mounts a volume in the source directory to run some boot-up scripts that essentially create the structure we need. I don't see any where to do this in the pipeline.yml file. Below is my compose that I am trying to move to a pipeline

{code}
# File is a work in progress
version: '3.3'
services:
  mysql:
    image: mysql:5.6
    environment:
      - MYSQL_ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD=true
    volumes:
      - $PWD/user-login-server/src/main/resources/sql:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d/:ro
  redis:
    image: redis
  build:
    image: anapsix/alpine-java:8_jdk
    command: ./gradlew  compileJava check assemble 
    working_dir: /root
    volumes:
      - $PWD:/root:rw
    depends_on:
      - mysql
      - redis
    environment:
      - HOST=$HOST

{code}

I am betting money I am not the only one who needs this
fields.summary: Support mounting volumes for test data in the Pipelines service containers

fields.description:
Wrong "Available" and "Total" size been displayed on LFS page. The [Plan details|https://bitbucket.org/account/admin/plan-users/] will show the correct and accurate information.

!3036199487-Screen%20Shot%202017-07-27%20at%202.57.33%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wrong Available and Total size been displayed on LFS page - Customer

fields.description: Our engineering organization enforces a squash merge strategy so it would be nice if we were able to set that as the default choice in the drop down.
fields.summary: Allow us to configure the default merge strategy

fields.description: Improve how we handle in Bitbucket Cloud LFS files removal and add the ability for the user to delete LFS files in bulk instead of one by one in the UI. It's even better if we could have an option to delete the stale LFS files i.e., the files not referred from HEAD of the default main branch.
fields.summary: Add the ability to remove LFS files in bulk

fields.description: I tried to import a repository to https://bitbucket.org/VictoryMC/multiverse-core, but my power went out half way through and now it seems to be corrupted. I cannot view or delete the repo.
fields.summary: Corrupt repository: won't finish creating and cannot delete

fields.description:
Create a  pull request and I am getting this error:

We were unable to load this page.

Thanks
fields.summary: We were unable to load this page.

After loader it shows:

bq. Error

We were unable to load this page.


I've checked "Network" tab in browser. Server response status is 500, and the response has HTML:

When contacting support, please provide the code below:\\
21928fc8e501471b87774e2b4331015c

cannot see diff in pull requests, all I get is this error message already reported in\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/14560 and https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/10903 but both are closed
fields.summary: We were unable to load this page.

Myself and others on our team are not able to load many of our Pull Requests.  We get the error:

*Error*\\
We were unable to load this page.

Looking at the console, we see:\\
!4142382728-pr-console-error.PNG|thumbnail!

It seems to only be affecting some of our PRs.

Unable to load this page

fields.description:
Dieter Developer needs an import function so that he could upload his codeship-steps.yml as well as his codeship-services.yml.

After the import Dieter Developer can use the result in his bitbucket-pipelines.yml definition under services and sets.
fields.summary: Codeship Importer for steps and services.yml

fields.description:
Bitbucket Cloud invitations have a 7 days expiry. This information is not provided or documented anywhere.

Suggestion, add the expiry warning into the invitation email to notify users.
fields.summary: Add the invitation expiry info into the invitation email

fields.description: It would be great to see the result of the last build in the repositories view which currently displays repository name, last update date and the visibility. Say "Last Build Result" column
fields.summary: Display build status in repository list
Give Javascript API request access to more API resources

fields.description:
I don't know why my repository doesn't let me add more user. It always loading... when I click Setting>User and group access

I also can not delete it

Anyone know how to fix it?
fields.summary: Can not delete or add user to repository

fields.description:
To escape the complexity of managing multiple accounts on bitbucket I am using email aliases and had my personal email as primary and an alias to my company issued email which is also configured as identity on my work computer.

When I perform actions locally (commits, merges etc.) in the git log the correct email address is used (the company one) and it's associated with my account on the side. Which is good.

However if  I perform any action from the site, e.g. approve a pull request then my primary email is added to the commit messages after a merge.

So my proposal is to allow assigning aliases to particular repositories to match the identity configured for the local repository in git.

I hope it makes sense.

I've already asked this as a question in the community portal, but it seems like it's not possible at the moment:

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/How-can-I-set-one-of-my-email-aliases-as-default-for-a/qaq-p/613757?posted=614298#U614298
fields.summary: Associate email alias with particular repositories

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm trying to run a pipeline at the url: https://bitbucket.org/24routier_team/tabitatour_backend/

I get the following error, which i guess is coming from the machine i picked:

mkdir ~/.ssh\\
mkdir: cannot create directory '/root/.ssh': File exists

Can you please provide some help,
fields.summary: Pipeline mkdir fails with "file exists"
Build failing due to OOM but works fine locally with same constraints.

fields.description: As suggested by the [reply|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/How-to-resolve-issues-automatically-when-users-push-code-to/qaq-p/593775] of Eric Henry, I create this feature request. Please consider implement this feature.
fields.summary: Resolve issues automatically when users push code to specific branch(es)

fields.description:
It seems that service containers are now regarded as the best-fit solution for replacing docker-compose in Pipelines:

BCLOUD-12757

However, by only supporting service containers, any use of docker-compose for local dev environments, requires developers to then maintain 2 duplicitous configuration files for virtually the same purpose (Pipelines service & Dockerfiles).

In my case, we have a complex docker-compose setup which spins up our local dev environment as well as our CI environment for running tests. If we want to migrate from Bamboo Server to BB Pipelines, I now need to start maintaining Pipelines Services in addition to docker compose.

One potential short term solution to this would be to adding functionality to allow importing Dockerfiles into service container definitions. At least then there's no need to maintain duplicitous pipelines/composer definitions.

However, ideally allowing docker-compose to be used would be the best-case scenario...
fields.summary: Support reading docker-compose file for service configuration

fields.description:
There is no way to customize the commit page and override diff view. At the moment, the only extension possible is adding of a webItem (basically a link) at org.bitbucket.commit.summary.info or org.bitbucket.commit.summary.actions.

We are building a version control tool for design mockups([http://versions.sympli.io](Link URL)) that displays visual diffs for design mockups, and we want to provide users with a seamless experience of changesets browsing with Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Add option to override diff view for a particular file type or folder name pattern

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I have another query please assistance the same.

How can i set branch permissions for all repositories instead of set branch permission individual repositories ?\\
I want to set default branch permission for all repository @ cloud Bitbucket like Bitbucket server "URL:  https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-branch-permissions-776639807.html "

Can you please provide some on line documentation links for resolve these two issues.

Regards,\\
Nitin Kumar
fields.summary: Common branch permission for all repositories

fields.description:
Hi bitbucket,

I really like what you have done so far! Easy and out of the box pipeline solution, congratulations.

The main feature that I am missing is a report parser and trend graph, I am sure many people would love to have such a feature, which is already a standard for all the CI tools.

I hope you will consider this enhancement and add it to your roadmap.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Report parser(xml,json) and trend graph

fields.description:
Bug with PR interface with {{git move}} .

Renamed folders in a repo, using {{git move <folder name>}} and pushed it.\\
Made a PR and the folders is mixed up!

Example from {{tig}} ({{git log}} tool):

* {bk => bk-me}/.htaccess
* {diud => di-ud}/.htaccess
* { fk => fk-ud } /.htaccess

Bitbucket's interface:

* { bk → di-ud }/.htaccess
* { diud → fk-ud }/.htaccess
* { fk → di-ud }/.htaccess

These is correctly when I look at my commits, but the interface, shows the mixed up.
fields.summary: Git move bug in PRs

fields.description:
Trying to push to {{ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy}} now gives the following error:

{code}
remote: abort: abandoned transaction found!
remote: (run 'hg recover' to clean up transaction)
{code}

I don't know precisely what caused this.  It's probably some command run by somebody between yesterday (2017-07-23 09:38 +0200) and today (2017-07-24 10:07 +0200).  Today, I just ran {{hg push}} and got this message.

I didn't find a place in the UI where I could request an {{hg recover}}.  I'm sorry if there is one and I missed it.  Otherwise, may I ask you to run it for us?  Thanks!
fields.summary: remote: abort: abandoned transaction found - run hg recover!

fields.description:
When using Pipelines or LFS for the first time, all admins of the team are shown a warning flag for 1 week following the first usage. Presently there is no way for an individual to hide this warning message or stop it. Instead, 1 week must pass before the dialog will expire.

The usage warning should be able to be dismissed by any admin of the team permanently if they so desire.
fields.summary: Pipelines and LFS usage warning pops up for 1 week after first usage

fields.description:
Hello,

I tried importing existing git repo but the repository isn't available...

Can you delete the repo i can't do it because i can't show the settings to delete it manually...

Thx.

https://bitbucket.org/meilleureville/api-v2
fields.summary: This repository is currently unavailable.

fields.description:
cannot see diff in pull requests, all I get is this error message\\
already reported in https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/10903 but it's closed
fields.summary: We were unable to load this page.

fields.description:
I imported a repository from GitHub, which went well and took less than a minute.

However I forgot some uncommitted work. So I deleted the Bitbucket repository, did my commit and did a fresh import. This time around the importer got stuck, the progress bar shows around 80% and the console underneath is empty.

After being stuck here for more than half an hour I navigate away. If I return to the repository it shows the bar progressing again, but eventually gets stuck in the same way. I tried making a second repository with a new name which also got stuck in the same way.

I rebooted my machine. Both repositories are still stuck. So I did a third repository which worked perfectly and just as fast as the first time. The console also showed the importing process.

I now have a working repository "JustInTime 3" and two repositories stuck in import which I cannot delete because settings are not available before importing is done "JustInTime" and "JustInTime 2". Are there any way to delete the two repositories which are stuck? Will they eventually timeout?

Cheers Martin
fields.summary: Stuck importing repository from GitHub

fields.description:
I've imported my github project but seems it got an error in the process: can't delete it or manage either way.

[https://bitbucket.org/hardcodeteam/p2pmessenger-base|https://bitbucket.org/hardcodeteam/p2pmessenger-base]
fields.summary: Repository unavailable This repository is currently unavailable.

fields.description: I saw "Error We were unable to load this page" error after i clicked the "diff" tab to see if i have a conflict. I don't know how to fix it. Looking in Chrome developer tools on console tab I can see 2 request link and when i check the first it was a 404 page, and another link return a json message {"type": "error", "error": {"message": "[Errno 28] No space left on device",... Is it about my device? I have more space so I think its not..
fields.summary: Error We were unable to load this page.

fields.description:
Currently, if you define the depth of the clone for bitbucket's pipelines, it is inherently --single-branch.

Whilst this produces a fast clone and is probably fine for most use cases.

My use case is that I want to a code sniff against changed files.

To that end I want to identify the files that have been changed vs master. This can't be done with a --single-branch.

So, being able to supply --no-single-branch would mean I would have the tip of master and the branch in question available and then I can determine what files are different between master and the branch.

Then only those files need to be changed.

Currently the project size is such that running the code sniff against the entire project takes several minutes, but against the files that are different between master and the branch, is just a few seconds.
fields.summary: Extend Pipeline support for --no-single-branch

fields.description:
Like in Jira, it would be really useful to define webhooks in general (under Webhooks page in the system setting or project settings), instead of per repository.

I wanted to add the same webhook to many repositories and I had to go over each repository manually and separately.

I would like to be able to create a common webhook once, for example in project settings, and assign specific repositories to it (just like in Jira), or have the webhooks be automatically inherited by all repositories in the project.
fields.summary: Add Webhooks page to system OR project settings

fields.description: When pushing new commits, I'd like to receive emails of my own commits for tracking purposes.
fields.summary: Allow email notification on self commits

fields.description:
I had been eagerly awaiting the ability to delete pull requests from bitbucket, only to find out there's a huge difference between bitbucket.org and bitbucket server. A community thread is involved with this: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Delete-a-Pull-Request/qaq-p/74341

The feature has already been approved and implemented in server 5.1:\\
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-3134

... and as that ticket states, there is nothing listed for bitbucket.org (which in itself should be a bug -- the two should definitely strive to have similar feature sets!).
fields.summary: Delete Pull Requests

fields.description: As a Bitbucket user I want PacScript to be an available language in the Respository Details->Language drop down so that I can associate it with my project.
fields.summary: Add PacScript as an available Language

fields.description:
That's not an issue but more a question and suggestion.

So it is related to Branches.

I can see there FILTERS: Active and Merged.

But all my branches are active. How can I move any branch to "Merged" state, so it will not appear in the list of active branches(1)?

Also, I have some branches, that are dead ends. They are definitely not active, so I dont want to see them in the list. Neither they are "Merged". I also don't want to delete such branches. They still contain useful code that I can use in future. SO I would like to have the third filter there, called "Archive" or like that(2).

And I believe some context help will be appreciated near by those filters(3), so anyone can clearly know how to move some branch to any category.
fields.summary: Ability to archive branches

fields.description: I have a vendor specific toolchain that is locked down to a single MAC address that I would like to use in my build process. It would be helpful if I was able to specify a MAC address for the container in bitbcuket-pipelines.yml so the toolchain would be guaranteed to run every invocation.
fields.summary: Specify MAC Address in bitbucket-pipelines.yml
use project name in repo path instead team name, i.e. <project-name/repo-name>

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I am wondering if we can check somewhere that we can see if members of the git repository has cloned the source code?

Is there a way to obtain this information resolved to their bitbucket account with their external IP address?\\
If yes, can we check how many times they have cloned the source code?

For your information we are using standard plan of cloud Bitbucket.

Thanks\\
Nitin Kumar
fields.summary: Track repository access

fields.description:
Issue BCLOUD-5942 - Adding a team to a private repo - Please look at the screenshot from this bug report.

In 5942 the screenshot shows Missed Opportunity # 1 in the user interface where it might make sense to allow sharing a Repo with a Team, but because the system does not allow it you get the red text instead.

Please look at the screenshot attached, case study # 2 or Missed Opportunity # 2 in the user interface.  This account is the administrator of Test Team 14 and Test Team 15.  There is a modal to switch from "Individual" to "Group."

This was the second place I thought I would be able to share a private repository from one team to another, but it has no way to share a private repo from Test Team 15 into one of the projects available to members of Test Team 14.  Try it and you get the red text again.

I have been working with support to try to solve this use case for me, and they identified a workflow that might technically satisfy what I'm asking for, but will never work in practice or at scale for any decently sized enterprises.

So, my very brief feature request, please add the capability for Enterprise Teams to share their repos with other Enterprise Teams!

Atlassian Support, if I understand correctly, suggested that we (the Team is called nd-oit) should create a Group in our Team, grant the permissions on whatever repositories we wanted to that Group, and add the users of the other Team to it.  We are currently planning on doing that for the small list of users that we will onboard this week and next, but I'm saying that long-term this will never work because the people with Administrator role are very busy, and don't like busy work.  Keeping two lists in sync is by definition busy work and there is no logical reason why anyone should do it, let alone doing it on-demand.

I could write an API Client to keep the members of Team B in sync with a group in my own Team... that seems quite onerous for what should be an extremely common use case.  Can you just enable the capability for team administrators to share a private repo from one team to another instead?

In the (current-state) user story,

# First "ND_HR-IS" must first establish their team.
# Members of HR-IS their team must all create accounts, and join the ND_HR-IS group. It would be helpful if we could get them to do this up-front. (Hint: They won't do this up-front.)
# Then, someone with the "nd-oit" team's Administrator role must

* create a sub-group of nd-oit (the first time)
* manually add each of the members of the "ND_HR-IS" team to that group (every time)

Manually keeping that list of team members updated as ND_HR-IS adds new team members.  Who is going to do that?  People with the Administrator role are busy and won't return my e-mails already when I try contacting them about this.  (Hint: They are never going to do that.)

In reality, this (current-state) user story will never happen because HR-IS is not using Bitbucket already.  We are onboarding them now, or at least we hope to do this.  It might turn out that their team is quite small, or quite large, we don't know!  But for the near future, members will be added one at a time.  It would be expedient if we did not have to remain permanently involved in adding them each individually.  Unfortunately HR-IS does not have any Git content of their own, and they are not yet interested in generating any, so getting them on Bitbucket even one by one is kind of a hard sell.

They may some day create their own repos and wikis, but they also may never do this.  They are most of them certainly not using Git right now.  We still wish to engage them on our private repos and help them create their own team so they can participate in our development process on Bitbucket better, and always have access to our most current documentation.  We are power Git users and we depend heavily on Bitbucket for code reviews and intra-team sharing.

Until HR-IS Admin engages ND-OIT Admin upon new team member's account creation, in the current-state, each new ND_HR-IS team member who joins the team has access to no content until ND-OIT admin acts to add the new team member to our team's group.  (Since nobody is going to agree to do that job, we can safely show that this story will never actually happen unless I write some API integration to support it.)

This is why the title of this enhancement is "Enterprise Onboarding Problem"

In the desirable "trivial enhancement" future state that is very desirable for me and my enterprise,

Just like I can grant Read-Only or Developer access to a private repo, to members of my team, or groups on my team... I can grant Read-Only access to one of my team's private repos, to ND_HR-IS team that I have Administrator rights on.

It would make sense if, in the case where I only have Admin on one team, I can grant my private repos to another team, but it has no effect on the users of that team until an Admin from that team adds it.  Then, after I granted that access, there would be some workflow on the Project configuration page (seems like it could go on the page attached here as screenshot) where an Admin from that team could add the shared repo to one of their team's Projects.

This just seems like such a natural feature that I don't understand why it doesn't already work that way.  Almost like Teams were bolted on as a feature for Enterprise users at some point, and it was just never considered that Teams might actually want to share with each other.

Users on that team would see my repository in the list of repos with their other Team repos.  Admin on each team can still control Project settings and may designate which repos are in which projects and which groups/teams have access to them, but the list of repos on a Team's project configuration pages no longer draws solely from the team's own projects, but also from the listing of any private repos that are shared with the team.
fields.summary: Enterprise Onboarding Problem - Teams can't share repos with other teams

fields.description:
Hi,

First i would suggest that the 'Recovery Codes' section should be made very obvious and stand out on the page,  bright colored or something, it was very easy to miss when under pressure to get the account setup and configured to interface with a client so i didn't even see them to download them.

Second, if you didn't download or have lost recovery codes the recovery of the account can only be done with the SSH Key and using a bash terminal.\\
The instructions of which are geared towards Linux users, my client was using OAuth and didn't have an SSH Key in (although one was associated).

It has taken a considerable amount of time to figure out how to get the bash working in windows, how to get authentication in windows bash and how to attach the SSH key to the authentication bash to get the recovery codes. - Could you not provide some picture instructions for windows users? Or even just upload your key and password here page and we will display your recovery code?

Also finally, is it possible to have another method of recovery? Perhaps SMS Message and secret code or something?

Thanks\\
Mike
fields.summary: Two Factor & Recovery

fields.description:
Hi,

* I push my image on a jfrog docker registry
* I set my bitbucket-pipeline to pull my image from this registry [(https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/using-docker-images-as-build-environments-792298897.html)](Link URL)

exemple :

{code}
#!yml

image:
  name: docker.your-company-name.com/account-name/java:8u66
  username: $USERNAME
  password: $PASSWORD
  email: $EMAIL
{code}

* If jfrog docker registry is V2 API version, bitbucket-pipeline failed telling "Unsupported docker v2 repository"
* If I configure jfrog docker registry with V1 API version it's OK.

Today with docker client CE 17.06, I can fallback to api V1 by configuring daemon with

{code}
#!bash

 --disable-legacy-registry=false 
{code}

but in future releases, docker client (> 17.12) will not support v1 api version anymore (https://docs.docker.com/release-notes/docker-ce/)...

regards,
fields.summary: Bitbucket pipeline cannot pull docker image from a v2 API repository

fields.description:
I would like to be able to add comments per line or file or commit within the origin of a branch.\\
On many occasions, people who write code would love some collaborative feedback on a large piece of code before it is ready to be merged into a master branch.\\
In most cases, one can speak directly with the colleague who pushed the changes or the colleague can make a pull request notifying everyone this is not meant for merger yet.\\
But where different time zones and work from home situations exist then problems tend to occur.\\
With the current solution of direct contact about pushed code, I cannot speak with the colleague until later, by which time I might forget some of the detail, or not have the time later. But as I am notified of push on the branch, I can comment immediately on questionable lines, files, and commits quickly. I also won't forget what I wished to have said in the period between noting it and the availability of the colleague.\\
If the solution of a pull request but not merged is used then the possibility is that everyone believes this intermediate code looks good, maybe with minor comments, then somebody approves it and merges because they were not aware of the exceptional circumstance.

Apologies if there is already a good solution for this type of scenario, but it does seem strange that I cannot comment on all origin code.
fields.summary: Ability to comment on branches

fields.description:
The main idea of having a global caches section is so we don't re-add the same code over and over in each pipeline. without removing it from the pipeline section so if the pipeline didn't define one we will use the global one, mean while if they did define one we will use the local caches section.

This will make the yml structure cleaner, and easy to manage.
fields.summary: Adding global caches section on the yml file

fields.description:
Basically, in the scripts section, you will add a lot of commands that you will execute in each pipeline so why don't we have a global command like image which will be used as the default commands that will be executed before executing any other command.

And it can be overwritten with in any section if they want, by just define a new before_script section inside the section itself then it will ignore the global one.

This is a feature that found on [Gitlab-ci|https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/yaml/#before_script] and I do find it better to clean up the file a bit.

The same will be for after_script as it will also make it easy to clean up after executing the code.
fields.summary: Adding a global before_script/after_script to the ymal file

fields.description:
When a new commit is added to the source branch, the pull request is not automatically updated with the latest change.

A dialog box showing this text is shown when the mouse is hovered on the edit button:\\
"There are new commits not included in this pull request. Update now"

The workaround for this is to press the "Update Now" button.

This issue only affects certain repositories.
fields.summary: Pull request not updating automatically

fields.description:
There was a previous suggestion to add unlisted repositories in 2013, but it was somewhat flawed in my opinion, so I decided to recreate it to evoke discussion of the matter.\\
I would have a lot of use out of this (for instance, placing on a resume or portfolio while still maintaining project secrecy and/or privacy.)

The suggested way of going about this is adding an option to add an 'Everyone' or 'Anonymous' principal to the repository's access settings. We could then grant or deny view access.

As previously stated, this option would only be available for repositories already marked Private, and if the repository is made Public, the existing setting won't be removed, but will also have no effect. However, to avoid potential abuses of people using this to bypass the private repository limit, you can either require a paid account to use this, or impose a unique viewer limit per day/week/month/etc (perhaps by IP or BitBucket account, or both.) Additionally, you could have this take up, for example, two private slots to grant temporary view access to the next two/four/some multiplier of BitBucket users that view the "unlisted" repository.

If you have any questions or concerns about this proposal, let me know, ideally we can reach a compromise.
fields.summary: Anonymous/View/Unlisted access to Repository

fields.description:
For all of our SaaS applications we require that our users be authenticated via a Google OpenID Connect identity provider. This typically involves us creating a new set of OAuth 2.0 client credentials in our Google Cloud Platform account, and then configuring the client application, Bitbucket, in this case, with the credentials, endpoints, and claims constraints.

This requirement allows us to centrally enforce specific authentication requirements (password complexity, 2FA, ...) instead of having to repeat the configuration in multiple places. It also allows us to ensure that credentials are only ever persisted in one place (Google).

As a bonus, being able to require that authentication _only_ occurs via this OpenID Connect identity provider would be great.
fields.summary: Add a way to authenticate using an external OpenID Connect identity provider

fields.description: The app switcher in the current UI has been removed. We want to bring back this functionality in the new interface so we can link Atlassian Cloud products together again.
fields.summary: App switcher in new Bitbucket UI

fields.description:

This page does not load (loader spins indefinitely) if the repository contains an empty bitbucket-pipelines.yml.

fields.description:
From feedback on the [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Use+SSH+keys+in+Bitbucket+Pipelines|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Use%2BSSH%2Bkeys%2Bin%2BBitbucket%2BPipelines] page

"I had to specify the key file being used (pipelines defaults to /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/data/id_rsa):

ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa <user>@<host> 'echo "connected to {{hostname}} as $USER"'

wanted to report in case other people were having similar issues"
fields.summary: Pipelines doesn't find SSH key in the default location as expected

When we try to remove a user from a team account and, this user belongs to a group, we face an message that states that the user access will be removed from *our* account, even though, we are removing from the team account.\\

Also, it's necessary to remove the entire group in order to remove the user access.

fields.description: Currently on Bitbucket Cloud, if a user has access to a repository, they would have access to all of the files/folders in the repository. But for some projects, we need grant specific user group access to specific files/folders in a repository.

fields.description:
To reproduce:\\
-Open the Repo overview page with any repo that has some history with PRs, watches , forks

* make sure you are using new BB UI
* make sure the left side menu is expanded and not collapsed
* play with the window resize and notice that when you squeeze it the table with PR and forks and not resizing properly to resize with the window resizing, see screen shot attached for visual
fields.summary: Resizeing a browser window is not rendering the table on the overview page properly

fields.description:
When a build is in progress, the build started timestamp is missing in the UI build view.\\
The icon for the timestamp is loaded but does not contain any timestamp. This also causes for the Docker stack icon to overlap on the Timestamp icon.
fields.summary: Build timestamp missing from In Progress pipelines builds

fields.description:
User Group with no Team permission not able to view Team Project (which the group have access to its repo) on their dashboard (https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/projects) but able to view it on Team profile (https://bitbucket.org/<Team-username>/profile/projects).

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a new User Group
# Uncheck "Create repositories" and "Administer Team"
# Add a User to the User Group
# Login using the User credential then view the https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/projects

h4. Expected Results
Users who have access to the Project's repositories should be able to view the projects on Dashboard even though they don't have the permission to create new repositories.

h4. Actual (Current) Results
Users unable view their projects on their Dashboard.
Users would need to navigate to https://bitbucket.org/<Team-username>/profile/projects to view the projects.
fields.summary: User Group with no Team permission unable to view projects on Dashboard

fields.description:
With git flow when you implement a feature of fix an issue that is done on the develop branch.

The code on the develop branch will eventually become the next version of the software.

So let's say I fixed issue 123 on the develop branch and included the issue in the commit message ({{Fix BCLOUD-123}}).

The issue will only get linked to the commit when the commit is merged to the master branch which is no good.

When a version is in development for a longer time you want to see what issues where referenced or fixed on the develop branch not only on the master branch.

Not only is the issue not fixed (which is debatable, it could be in a {{pending fix}} state instead or something like that) it isn't even referenced!
fields.summary: git flow - Fixing issues on the develop branch via commit message

fields.summary: Disable notification for Pipeline builds notification
